    • Method Detail

      • setClassPath

        void setClassPath(java.lang.String classpath)
        Set the class path so that the flow analyzer can find classes.

      • addToClassPath

        void addToClassPath(java.lang.String classorjar)

      • addClass

        void addClass(java.lang.String cls)
        Add a class to the set to be analyzed. This will also implicitly add all classes that this class depends upon (e.g. calls, inherits, or uses in any way) transitively. It should be called with the starting class and any other class that might be used that cannot be found explicitly (e.g. classes loaded using Class.forName()). It can be called with all the classes to be analyzed as well.

      • addDescriptionFile

        void addDescriptionFile(java.lang.String xmlfile)
        Load XML file describing special cases.

      • addDefaultDescriptionFile

        void addDefaultDescriptionFile()

             boolean fg)

      • setStartClass

        void setStartClass(java.lang.String cls)
        Set the start class (otherwise all starts are considered).

      • setProjectFilter

        void setProjectFilter(JflowMaster.ProjectFilter pf)
        Set the project filter for the flow analysis. The project filter determines whether a class should be considered a system or a project class. Project classes are analyzed in more detail than system classes.

      • isProjectClass

        boolean isProjectClass(com.ibm.jikesbt.BT_Class bc)

      • setupAnalysis

        void setupAnalysis()

      • analyze

        void analyze()
             throws JflowException
        This method does the flow analysis, returning when everything has been computed. It can be called multiple times in which case it will do incremental analysis, only looking at those that were noted by the add new source methods and whatever they affect. The factory is used to create appropriate instances of methods, sources, and values.
        Throws:
        JflowException
